appearances.snippet: this morning, north bay congressman jared huffman toured the flooding and damage left behind. the first stop was at the santa venetia levee in san rafael. congressman huffman was joined by marin county officials. the county said the levee breached and crews had to make emergency repairs. that levee protects more than 500 homes. it's 40 years old, and the county says it's been deteriorating with age. marin county supervisor mary sackett was working to get federal grants to improve the levee, but she says the trump administration canceled the grants. huffman says he won't give up on securing funding. >> this is not sustainable in the long term. levee like this, especially with these tides and all of the volatility with our weather. so we're not going to give up on funding that longer term solution. >> huffman and the marin county leaders also went to court a madera, where he spoke with the mayor and the mayor of larkspur. they stopped by lucky drive. it's back open now, but this video shows just how bad it got over the weekend and why they chose this as one of the spots to tour.
